name: Subcontracts for Commercial Items and Commercial Components

text.text: This subpart prescribes the policies limiting the contract clauses a contractor may be required to apply to any subcontractors that are furnishing commercial items or commercial components in accordance with 41 U.S.C. 3307.
This subpart applies to all contracts and subcontracts. For the purpose of this subpart, the term “subcontract” has the same meaning as defined in Part 12.

a.text: Contractors and subcontractors at all tiers shall, to the maximum extent practicable:

1.text: Be required to incorporate commercial items or nondevelopmental items as components of items delivered to the Government; and

2.text: Not be required to apply to any of its divisions, subsidiaries, affiliates, subcontractors or suppliers that are furnishing commercial items or commercial components any clause, except those—

i.text: Required to implement provisions of law or executive orders applicable to subcontractors furnishing commercial items or commercial components; or

ii.text: Determined to be consistent with customary commercial practice for the item being acquired.

b.text: The clause at 52.244-6, Subcontracts for Commercial Items, implements the policy in paragraph (a) of this section. Notwithstanding any other clause in the prime contract, only those clauses identified in the clause at 52.244-6 are required to be in subcontracts for commercial items or commercial components.

c.text: Agencies may supplement the clause at 52.244-6 only as necessary to reflect agency unique statutes applicable to the acquisition of commercial items.

text.text: The contracting officer shall insert the clause at 52.244-6, Subcontracts for Commercial Items, in solicitations and contracts other than those for commercial items.
